title: Jojo Rabbit, review: this feeble, one-note Nazi comedy fails to land a single meaningful blow
text:
Dir: Taika Waititi; Starring: Roman Griffin Davis, Scarlett Johansson, Thomasin McKenzie, Taika Waititi, Sam Rockwell, Alfie Allen, Rebel Wilson, Stephen Merchant. 12A cert, 108 mins.

Taika Waititi’s Jojo Rabbit has been billed as an “anti-hate satire”, presumably in case anyone thought a comedy about Adolf Hitler might turn out to be spicily pro. In fact, the film is an even bleaker proposition than that: despite the subject’s supreme candidacy for mockery, it somehow fails to land a single meaningful hit.

Loosely adapted from Christine Leunens’s novel Caging Skies, Jojo Rabbit unfolds during the Third Reich’s dying days, when 10-year-old Jojo Betzler (Roman Griffin Davis) dreams of fighting...
